intro: Sphenogyne hispida, commonly known as the rough sphenogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive textured appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
